website_summaries.verdict: There is something for everyone in the Core Set 2019 set, ranging from the insanely bulky Gigantosaurus to the legendary bear “Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma,” and so much more to revamp your deck with all-new strategies.
pros: Includes 36 booster packs, with 540 total cards
There are a whopping 280 cards to find in this expansive set, which pulls a wide range of creatures, heroes, and artifacts from multiple planes
cons: Not only are some of the most powerful cards especially rare, you aren’t going to find all 280 cards in a single Core Set 2019 booster box

customer_reviews.title: Not factory sealed
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken pictures, didn't know until I bought a box from a store but this one was not factory sealed as it lacked the wizard logo on it. If you do still buy, check for logo and if none, take picture post here and demand refund. Figured I'd warn those that don't want to risk it.
customer_reviews.author: David Q

customer_reviews.title: Not tampered with, but looked it
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot on here about how the packs were tampered with. When mine came in, it was shrinkwrapped... but the boosters had little cuts on the top and the bottom. I honestly thought it had been tampered with, until I opened everything. Mythics, foil rares, an elder dragon, several planeswalkers... Unless these were the dumbest scammers ever, my set was just fine. Just figured I'd pass that along, if any others find it useful.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R

customer_reviews.title: Factory Sealed
customer_reviews.text: My box came factory sealed. Be sure to pay attention to who you are purchasing from though. If it says "Sold by <vendor name> and Fulfilled by Amazon", check the vendor and make sure they have good ratings. Or just buy directly from Amazon to lower your chances of fraud. People complaining about lack of card drops don't seem to understand that drops are, by design, random. That is how random drops work, people. Buy cards to play and have fun, not because you are expecting some high-value drop. That said, I bought this booster box for my 11 year old and he pulled some pretty good/expensive cards.
customer_reviews.author: Dean D.

customer_reviews.title: Good product! Reviews are for item, not sellers.  Just always inspect the box.
customer_reviews.text: Pulled Nicol, foil planeswalkers, etc. Was not tampered with. Remember, these reviews are for the item, not the actual seller. Just check the box when you get it. 1) does it have the wizards shrink wrap? (yes it only on the top half) 2) the slits in the packs are normal
customer_reviews.author: CoyoteHerder

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Purchase/Good Set
customer_reviews.text: Purchased from a 3rd party via Amazon. Box arrived in good condition, factory sealed. I pulled one planeswalker, but several Elder Dragons and a few other nice mythics. As an aside: a few of my friends were incredulous when I told them I purchased booster boxes via Amazon. I have for several years now, without a problem. Shipping is very fast, prices are good, and products are legitimate; so, I recommend Amazon for box purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Peetzaa

customer_reviews.title: Worst box opening ever.
customer_reviews.text: If i would have gotten 3 or more mythics I may have been happier, but I opened 2 mythics and they weren't even the good ones. This box opening made me realize that m19 cards are better bought as singles. Even Amonkhet was more exciting.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE DAMAGED/WAREHOUSE INSPECTED OPTION
customer_reviews.text: The package came with "factory shrinkwrap" and a seal stating it was "Amazon inspected". Upon opening the box, I quickly discovered that every single package of cards was torn open, and it only came with 35 of the 36 booster packs. Overall kind of confused and disappointed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews about a lot of people complaining about the box being tampered with and took a shot at buying this they must have bought a used box cause nothing about my package was tampered with it was completely sealed and I got a lot of good cards I even pulled a planeswalker out of one booster pack I can't complain will buy again from this shop

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and items recieved factory sealed.
customer_reviews.text: I was rather hesitant to order one of these after seeing other people received repackaged boxes. Decided to give it a try though and I'm not dissapointed. It came sealed and in excellent condition as well as a day early. I also got quite a nice haul of cards. Overall very happy and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: matthew harless

customer_reviews.title: Go elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: First review was removed, I guess cause I called them out. I bought this direct from this site. They shipped the booster box in a bubble mailer, corner's crushed, opened box anyways. I believe this site made a direct deal with the manufacturer and the cards they give this site are second class. All the mythic and rares were curled, funny thing the commons/un were not. It's a good set but I think would be wise to get it elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it

customer_reviews.title: Replacement was still factory sealed, happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: All packs were opened and missing cards the first time. Product was unopened the 2nd time. So I changed my rating, just advise to video the opening of all magic cards from the amazon box to checking the booster packs. I love Amazon so I really hope they catch the theif.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fast service

My daughter and I had a great time unboxing it and I got to pass my childhood experience on to her. I will be ordering again and again.

product_meta.title: Magic: The Gathering Core Set 2019 Booster Box | 36 Booster Packs (540 Cards)
product_meta.description: A booster box contains 36 Core Set 2019 booster packs (M19, sometimes “Core 19”), the follow-up to the hit expansion, Dominaria. Each pack contains 15 Magic cards. Pick your favorites, put them in your deck, and battle!
feature_bullets: A booster box contains 36 Core Set 2019 booster packs (M19, sometimes “Core 19”), the follow-up to the hit expansion, Dominaria. Each pack contains 15 Magic cards. Pick your favorites, put them in your deck, and battle!

With a rare or mythic rare card in every pack, your booster box is full of game-changing Magic cards and innovative strategies to discover. Each pack also contains 3 uncommon cards, 10 common cards, and 1 basic land card. (Premium foil card 1:67).
Core Set 2019 includes dragons like Nicol Bolas, the Ravager or Lathliss, Dragon Queen; planeswalkers like Sarkhan, Dragonsoul—even some of the most potent cards printed to date, like Omniscience.
Your Core Set 2019 booster box holds enough packs to host your own booster draft with as many as twelve friends. (Note: a booster draft requires more basic land cards than a booster box includes.)

Magic: The Gathering is the first modern collectible card game. Magic has inspired more than 20 million fans over 25 years, from the first dragons and angels to today’s planeswalkers and Commander decks.

Wizards of the Coast has been making the world’s best strategy games for almost 30 years: Magic: The Gathering (MTG), Dungeons & Dragons (D&D), many board games under the Avalon Hill umbrella, and more. Explore them all, discover new favorites, and make new friends along the way.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars228 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
